etymologies: early 16th century: from medieval Latin (herba) angelica ‘angelic (herb)’, so named because it was believed to be efficacious against poisoning and disease

definitions: a tall aromatic plant of the parsley family, with large leaves and yellowish-green flowers. Native to both Eurasia and North America, it is used in cooking and herbal medicine.

notes.text: Genus Angelica, family Umbelliferae: many species, especially the cultivated A. archangelica

shortDefinitions: tall aromatic plant of parsley family

definitions: the candied stalk of the angelica plant.
shortDefinitions: candied stalk of angelica, used in confectionery and cake decoration
